intro: Polyscias macdowallii, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to New Zealand. It is a large, evergreen shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height. The plant features a slender, unbranched trunk with a fibrous, rough bark and compound leaves that are alternate and pinnate. Its foliage is characterized by dark green, glossy leaves with a prominent midrib and serrated margins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by red berries that are an important food source for native birds.
